page.title: 16OUR POLICEMAN
page.content: {The local policeman}was interviewed. {Community policing}is an idea to help people and the police to get to know each other better. At one time Panda cars were used for patrols, but this method lacked the personal touch. It was decided that policemen could walk or use a bicycle. By getting to know you, the policeman will rely on you and trust you and sometimes you can help the police prevent crime. He doesn't carry a gun. He receives instructions through his radio. He has a lot of paperwork to do. Also he has a crime file. He carries an accident book, crime reports and a gun certificate. If he needs assistance he can contact a patrol car or the C.I.D. He can get a police dog as well.
